The language that used to be spoken in the whole south of France, called Occitan (or Langue d'Oc), is still spoken in some villages and is actively recovered by some associations in the big cities (manily Carcassone, Béziers, Montpellier, Narbonne).
Airports in Languedoc-Roussillon include Montpellier, Carcassonne, Beziers and Perpignan.

The Charm of Languedoc Roussillon is captured in hundreds of villages, each with an unique character and individual charm. Predominantly a wine growing region, many villages are famous for excellent individual wines.

content=In the southern France, nearby the City of Carcassonne UNESCO site, enjoy week-ends and holidays in a charming country landscape of vineyards, pine forest trees and hilly meadows. 
We propose you customized holidays : tourist accomodations (guest-houses, studios and bedrooms), a restaurant L'Auberge de Pommayrac (famous local products and wines), a horse and pony riding centre (lessons, trail riding and courses), and also a watersports centre in the town of Couiza (canoe kayaking on the Aude river). 
We organise language + horse riding courses for teens and youngsters. Tailormade vacations for adults and families also.
